title: Decouple solvers for per-solver Inspect versions
description: Allow each solver to run in its own dependency context so Inspect versions can vary by agent without cross-conflicts.
acceptance_criteria: - Each solver can declare its Inspect version\n- Docker/local workflows install per-solver deps without impacting other solvers\n- Docs updated with new workflow

title: Inventory Inspect usage + version constraints per solver
description: Audit agent_baselines codepaths and solver scripts to identify Inspect APIs in use and any version-specific behaviors; propose target Inspect versions per solver.
acceptance_criteria: - List of Inspect APIs used per solver\n- Proposed Inspect version range per solver\n- Any breaking changes/compatibility risks called out

title: Add make target for solver env smoke tests
description: Add a Makefile target (e.g., make smoke-solvers) that calls the solver env smoke test script.
acceptance_criteria: - make target documented in AGENTS.md or README\n- Target runs the new smoke script
notes: Duplicate of agent-baselines-24n.9 (smoke test + make target consolidated).

title: Add new solver onboarding checklist
description: Extend docs/per_solver_envs.md (or README) with a concise checklist for adding a new solver sub-project and verifying it works.
acceptance_criteria: - Checklist covers pyproject+uv.lock, setup/demo updates, env vars\n- Mentions running smoke test target

title: Verify per-solver Inspect isolation (react vs new solver)
description: Create a simple validation step (manual or scripted) showing two solvers can use different inspect_ai versions without conflict (e.g., react vs another solver migrated to a uv sub-project). Document exact commands and expected output.
acceptance_criteria:
- Documented validation step with exact commands
- Confirms distinct inspect_ai versions across two solvers

title: Design per-solver dependency strategy
description: Decide the mechanism to support per-solver Inspect versions (e.g., per-solver dependency spec + uv override, per-solver pyproject, or multi-lock setup) and document the chosen approach.
acceptance_criteria: - Written design note with tradeoffs\n- Chosen approach + file layout\n- Migration plan for existing solvers
notes: Dependency on inventory removed; design can proceed in parallel. Inventory still needed for compat checks.
close_reason: Strategy decided: per-solver uv sub-projects; design/migration docs tracked in agent-baselines-24n.8.

title: Add per-solver dependency specs + sync tooling
description: Introduce a per-solver uv sub-project for each solver (solvers/<solver>/pyproject.toml + solvers/<solver>/uv.lock) so solvers can pin different inspect_ai versions and optional deps without cross-contamination. Provide a consistent setup/run entrypoint (setup.sh + demo.sh) and minimal shared tooling to create/refresh a solver env.
acceptance_criteria:
- Each solver sub-project includes pyproject.toml + committed uv.lock
- setup.sh installs solver-specific deps (uv sync --project)
- demo.sh runs via uv run --project
- No cross-solver dependency pollution
notes: Scaffolded React subproject: solvers/react/pyproject.toml; added setup.sh to uv sync --project; demo.sh now uses uv run --project.

title: Update Docker builds for per-solver deps
description: Adjust docker/Dockerfile and Makefile so each solver image installs its own dependency set (including its Inspect version) without inheriting a single shared Inspect pin.
acceptance_criteria: - Solver images build with their own Inspect version\n- Base image no longer forces a single Inspect pin\n- make shell uses solver-specific deps

title: Update solver setup/demo scripts for per-solver deps
description: Revise solvers/<solver>/setup.sh and demo.sh to use the new per-solver dependency tooling and ensure local runs select the right Inspect version.
acceptance_criteria:
- setup.sh installs solver-specific deps
- demo.sh runs against that environment reliably
- At least 2 solvers updated (react + one more)
- No shared global env required
notes: Updated solvers/react/setup.sh + demo.sh + README.md for per-solver uv project.

title: Add Inspect compatibility layer (if needed)
description: Introduce a small compat module to smooth API differences across Inspect versions used by different solvers; update solver imports to use it where required.
acceptance_criteria: - Compat helpers added (only if gaps exist)\n- Solvers build against targeted Inspect versions\n- No version-specific branching sprinkled throughout code

title: Adjust tests/CI for per-solver Inspect versions
description: Update test workflows and docs so tests can run against solver-specific Inspect versions (or a default) without conflicts.
acceptance_criteria: - Tests can run locally with the new env scheme\n- CI (if present) documents how to run per-solver tests\n- No hidden dependency on a single Inspect version

title: Document per-solver Inspect version workflow
description: Update README and AGENTS.md to explain the per-solver dependency model (uv sub-project per solver), including how to set Inspect versions, generate/commit solvers/<solver>/uv.lock, and run solvers/tests/Docker with the new workflow. Include a short migration plan for existing solvers.
acceptance_criteria: - README updated with new setup instructions\n- AGENTS.md reflects new workflow\n- Example commands updated

title: Add per-solver env smoke test (script + make target)
description: Create a lightweight smoke test that iterates solver uv sub-projects (solvers/<solver>/pyproject.toml), runs uv sync as needed, and verifies the solver can import inspect_ai and reports its version. Include a Makefile target (e.g. make smoke-solvers) that runs this check.
acceptance_criteria:
- Script runs across listed solvers
- Verifies inspect_ai import/version per solver
- Fails fast with clear error if a solver env is broken
- Makefile target runs the smoke check and is documented

title: Ignore .ccb_config session metadata
description: Add .ccb_config/ to .gitignore so local CCB session files never show up as untracked changes.
